website_summaries.verdict: This sock aid is ideal for individuals with limited hand strength and dexterity who need to wear compression stockings. Be aware that it does require some hip and back flexibility to use.
pros: Helps those with limited hand strength and dexterity put on compression stockings
Epoxy finish ensures it will not snag or run your stockings
Helpful for individuals with arthritis in their hands
cons: Some hip and back flexibility is required to use this properly
Comes in multiple sizes, so be sure you get the right one for your foot and calf

customer_reviews.title: Quick, Easy and Painless
customer_reviews.text: When I had to wear compression stockings I was devastated as they're impossible to put on, especially with the arthritis in my right hand. The Stocking Donner made it a snap to put the stockings on. Quick, easy and painless. It came with simple instructions. It's sturdy and well built. Thank you Jobst.
customer_reviews.author: Aandaco

customer_reviews.title: Wear compression stockings - you need this!
customer_reviews.text: I had quit wearing my compression stockings because I could not get them on. I tried this and it WORKS. It is rather large but it does the job. I recently made a trip where I was going to be standing for long periods of time. I put this in my suitcase first and packed my clothes around it. I would recommend this to anyone who has to wear compression stockings.
customer_reviews.author: bbfan

customer_reviews.title: Can't Use It!
customer_reviews.text: The friend that I bought this for, is unable to use it. He has back issues and his compression stockings are very tight. He could only get one to come close to his calf and it bunched up and he couldn't pull them up. He is unable to unravel it or grab it in order to pull it up. I had high hopes since Jobst has their name on it. His stockings are Jobst but this appliance doesn't work for this guy! Why can't someone design a simpler device like the plastic ones, only in thin metal perhaps. Tight compression stockings break the plastic ones. We are both very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: elfwood

customer_reviews.title: Huge help after back surgery!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use with compression stockings after back fusion surgery. Even with the strongest stockings, this worked very well, and I did not have to break my back precautions. A hint: pull the stockings almost all the way down, until just an inch or so of the toe is hanging down.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Shogren

customer_reviews.title: We love it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 89 year old father in law. He was having a hard time putting on his compression stockings, so he would not wear them on a regular basis. I helped him with the stocking donner one day and the next day i found him using it himself. It sure made it much easier to put the stockings on. The more you use it the easier and faster you get. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: blee

customer_reviews.title: The donner is a great device. Make sure that you get the right ...
customer_reviews.text: The donner is a great device. Make sure that you get the right size. For instance, on my normal size leg, I was able to pull the sock along my leg with no problem. Also, I had no problem putting my foot into the sock. However, on my leg that was swollen, I was not able to use the donner as it was too small to pull up the entire length of my leg. S, make sure that you get a size that fits the larger leg. I had to return the item and had no problem doing so.
customer_reviews.author: Cleo

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have
customer_reviews.text: This contraption makes those hard to put on tight compression socks an ease. My husband has to wear these compression socks and what a job to get them on but with this he does it all by himself. What a time saver. I wished i was the one to come up with this idea as i would be a billionaire by now. God Bless the inventor.
customer_reviews.author: Rae Jean Young

customer_reviews.title: Donated this contraption
customer_reviews.text: My mother really needs help with putting on socks. I was so hoping for a fix by buying her this sock donner. Well, it is awkward to use, especially if you have trouble bending forward, like my mother does. Putting the sock on the contraption is not easy especially for seniors who struggle with hand dexterity. The leg width of this contraption was way too small for my mother's legs. I tried it myself and I find it not very useful. I was going to return it, but it was past the return deadline. I donated it.
customer_reviews.author: AnimalLover

customer_reviews.title: Works with Practice
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 85 year old husband. He couldn't use it at first--between the stiffness of the socks and trying to pull it over, it was difficult. I was having to put his support socks on him every morning. Then we worked on it a bit and now he puts on his socks every morning with the help of the Stocking Donner.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Y

customer_reviews.title: I love this donner
customer_reviews.text: I love this donner. No more broken nails or sprained fingers. This product allowed me to put my stockings on by myself without help. It was the last thing that allowed me to get ready in the morning completely independently. Thank you for creating this product. Comment: please obtain the gloves to accompany this and the adhesive to keep them up and then you will not have to worry about the compression stockings anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me. Reading other reviews I had ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work for me. Reading other reviews I had the same problem--the stocking slipped when I inserted my foot. Also, both the box and the product were damaged. They used a too small box and the metal broke through and scratched the bottom edges. It was returned and not reordered because of the slipping.
customer_reviews.author: Celia

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The item it self was very god but I was not able to get compression socks on my foot. After many many tries I sent it back. Cost $24.95 to get it and $16 to send it back. I tought as a Prime member shipping back was included but I guess not.
customer_reviews.author: James Drummond

customer_reviews.title: Greatest thing invented
customer_reviews.text: I have to put on compression stocking everyday. I could not do that without the use of this. Greatest thing invented. I have two of them now, so when I go camping I have one of them in the camper already.
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: Makes putting on compression socks much easier!!
customer_reviews.text: My feet are extra wide - so I cannot use it as shown. Instead I lay it down - up against the wall - and with a slight angle to my foot - slide into it - straightening my foot as I go past my toes. Once I figured it out it saved the day - its the ONLY way I can manage to get my compression socks on. Glad I bought it. I almost sent it back - until I figured out the best method that works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Bob

customer_reviews.title: Support hose donner is worthless with support hose, I am sorry to say.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like I have already evaluated the hose donner before. I tried to use it, but the tight support hose will not work in the donner. I would not have believed it, but it is so. I was sorry because my arthritic fingers are not working too well at putting on my support hose. I thought I had found the perfect solution, but sadly, I could not make them work. Even had my husband try and he was not sucsessful. They are just too contrary.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Good item, just not for people with limitations bending/reaching
customer_reviews.text: The Donner appears to work as advertised. However, for me it just didn't work. I have thick calves and my legs were a little too thick to go through it well. Also, I am not quite flexible enough to use it properly-- you need mobility to bend over more than I can. So for an average-sized person without bending limitations, I'd say it would work well as advertised. Just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a life saver.
customer_reviews.text: The Doc"s decided I should wear compression hose.What a struggle every morning trying to get them on. Then I found the Jobst site on Amazon and one thing led to another and here was something called a"donner". With further investigation it turned out to be a contraption to help put your socks on. Boy does it work. No creases, socks not up high enough, socks much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Cook

customer_reviews.title: If you wear any type of compression stockings YOU NEED THIS
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the best product made to help with putting on compression socks. There is nothing to compare to it. All the other gadgets are junk and useless to help you but this one is NOT junk. Follow the instructions and practice a few times and you'll be a pro. IF you are short place the heel of the sock all the way UP on the device and then insert your toes.
customer_reviews.author: Adele Vogel

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  This works
customer_reviews.text: This donner makes the difference between struggling for 15 min+ to get my compression stockings on and zipping them on in less than a minute.
customer_reviews.author: Born to Ride

customer_reviews.title: Its a little tricky to use. Not a bad set up.
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be a great tool for putting on compression socks, but following instructions they still dont stay on. Every time I step "in" as instructed the socks come off. It's really solid build. I will try and conquer!
customer_reviews.author: Mason bee lady 🐝

customer_reviews.title: This is an essential tool to have if you have trouble putting on compression stockings .
customer_reviews.text: This makes a big difference in being able to put tight stockings on, in fact it makes the difference between being able to put them on and not being able to put them on.
customer_reviews.author: garlic heart

customer_reviews.title: Too small so it was unusable.
customer_reviews.text: This was way too small even for a small lady. I'd recommend getting a bigger size. It was so small she could get it over her foot to get the compression stocking on. If you can get the right size these work great.
customer_reviews.author: casey

customer_reviews.title: This particular one was recommended by my daughter
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for me as I wouldn’t ever get them on without this. This particular one was recommended by my daughter. She started out with a plastic one & threw it away. She said it was useless & then purchased this one which she loves. So quick & easy to use I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my grandmother. It stretched her compression stockings out too much and she said it is difficult to use. It's under her bed collecting dust now.
customer_reviews.author: VKS

customer_reviews.title: Handles too short
customer_reviews.text: The socks fit on this easily. The handles are too short, though, making it very hard to grab them to pull on the socks. Apparently my short stature includes arms that are shorter than the manufacturer designed for.
customer_reviews.author: rightimage

customer_reviews.title: Possibly more useful with lower strength compression stockings
customer_reviews.text: did not find this helpful with the 20-30mmHg Knee-stockings. Possibly more useful with lower strength compression stockings, which I have not yet tried.
customer_reviews.author: CelticKirk

customer_reviews.title: Does all kinds of socks. Short ones, tall ones,support hose,and compression socks
customer_reviews.text: I no longer have to ask someone to help me with getting my socks on. Wish I had this years ago. My father would have been so happy to have had one of these. Knee surgeries are great but putting on socks is a pain after wards
customer_reviews.author: Great grandmother

customer_reviews.title: Too wide for normal sized stockings
customer_reviews.text: I found this very difficult to use. Mainly because the portion which the stocking slips over is so wide. I really struggled to get the stocking over the middle. It did not say anywhere that it was for wider stockings. I bought another brand which works wonderfully so beware if you don’t have a wide stocking.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Makes a Hard Job Easier
customer_reviews.text: With age, don't bend as easy as I used to. This device makes getting my support stocking on a lot easier. What used to take me a few minutes now takes me a few seconds. Would recommend this Stocking Donner
customer_reviews.author: Chuck81008

customer_reviews.title: Smaller stocking donner
customer_reviews.text: It was much smaller than one I have already. Thus I have to lift it up and pull onto my foot, rather than leave it on floor and slide foot into it like my other one I have.
customer_reviews.author: redchevy

customer_reviews.title: The handles make the difference.
customer_reviews.text: Great product for my husband to get his socks on. Sometimes he forgets how to put the sock on it to get started but once it’s ready the hand grips really make it easy.
customer_reviews.author: Moon baby

customer_reviews.title: was one of the most recommended sock donners
customer_reviews.text: I found the instructions easy to follow. It didn't work with one particular style of stocking, but it may have been my error in usage. Otherwise, it worked fine with other stockings.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Use the every day
customer_reviews.text: The sock donner works great. I have to use this product every day and I could not put my socks on. This product was recommended to me professional people.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Whisker

customer_reviews.title: not a help
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult for my 92 year old mother to use. She needed help putting on her support stockings. I could do it with this device, but I could do it without the device as well. This did not help her. I would not recommend buying.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Fenichel

customer_reviews.title: Easy way for performing a difficult job
customer_reviews.text: I am 75 , and could not don the prescription hose without this device, after a short learning curve donning is easily accomplished. I tried a device with pull up cords which I could not use.
customer_reviews.author: Gratk

customer_reviews.title: It was very hard for me to pull the compression ...
customer_reviews.text: It was very hard for me to pull the compression stocking onto the Donner, but once I got it on fully, then it was a big help to put my toe into it and pull it up. I would buy it again. I have thigh high at 15-20 hg. I have not tried it yet on my knee high compressions.
customer_reviews.author: Weesie

customer_reviews.title: This product would be great if the side rails were 3 feet high
customer_reviews.text: This product would be great if the side rails were 3 feet high. My husband cannot bend low enough to use it successfully.
customer_reviews.author: TF

customer_reviews.title: Mike putting socks on easy
customer_reviews.text: Doctor says wear COMPRESSION SOCKS. Putting them on without the Jobst 110913 Stocking Donner is very hard. This things takes the effort out of it.
customer_reviews.author: allan knisley

customer_reviews.title: Best invention!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Once I learned how to use this properly, it has helped me out so much!
customer_reviews.author: Daralyna

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Sitting in a box. Just never got the hang of using it. Finally got used to pulling up the 30 weights by hand.
customer_reviews.author: CatEyze

customer_reviews.title: If person older beware.
customer_reviews.text: My 92 year old mother could not use. It hurts her leg too much. Be careful if you buy The company that ships to you will not refund unless their mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Compression socks.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Donner device to help put them on. It works very well. The socks are a good fit and quality and ordered another pair. At my age, I need help to get them on.
customer_reviews.author: Carmie Egger

customer_reviews.title: like my friend can't
customer_reviews.text: When you can't bend down to put on your socks, like my friend can't, you better get Jobst Stocking Donner! That way your wife won't have to get down on her knees to put them on for you.....keeps you independent!!! Something we all need to do as we get older!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Makes wearing compression socks easy. I'd give it 5 stars if the handles were about 2 inches longer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must for compression sock wearers!
customer_reviews.text: Makes putting on heavy compression socks a breeze! Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.author: Tonya M. Schlueter

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: First one arrived damaged and seller promptly replaced it. Definitely recommend it and the seller 👍
customer_reviews.author: teal

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Using this stocking donner my 80-year-old mother can now put on her compression stockings by herself. We tried other types and this one is the best. This makes her feel very independent. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tory J Lea

customer_reviews.title: What a FANTASTIC invention. The "flat pad" that others offered did ...
customer_reviews.text: Now I am not "worn out" after putting on my husbands compression socks. What a FANTASTIC invention. The "flat pad" that others offered did nothing. Highly recommend purchasing/using this item.
customer_reviews.author: nice lady

customer_reviews.title: This is a sturdy product and should last a long time.
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy product and should last a long time. However there are two areas that could be improved. First the handles could be further apart. When loading the stocking onto the center semicircle, the handles get in the way. Secondly the handles could be about 2 inches higher to ease reaching for the donner to pull on the stocking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must for compression socks wearers
customer_reviews.text: Sounds silly, but this device is life-changing. I can now handle putting on my compression by myself.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Funk

customer_reviews.title: It does what it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: A convenient way to don support hose without straining your back!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Scott

customer_reviews.title: strong sturdy
customer_reviews.text: great product but was not easy to use by my father but i think if you have good mobility it would be great
customer_reviews.author: lori as

customer_reviews.title: Very Helpful
customer_reviews.text: Takes some practice, but once you get used to it, very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Lou H

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: It helps me to put on my compression socks. Couldn't do it without this.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Not for big feet:-(
customer_reviews.text: Nice idea, it too small for my size 15-16 EEEE feet. Sorry 😢
customer_reviews.author: Zapatogrande

customer_reviews.title: returned
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for socks and stockings, but, does not work for pantyhose
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and very sturdy. Was a gift but it appeared to be ez to use.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Miller

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: Before buying the jobst stocking donner it would take me about 10 minutes per stocking to put on my compression stockings and I would be out of breath and tired. Now it takes me only about 4-5 minutes for both stockings and I don't have to work at it. Thanks for the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was anxious to find something to assist with the difficult task of putting on compression stockings. With arthritic hands, I found it was not as helpful as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for FIL with CIDP. Immensely helpful...he can, even with nueropathy in his hands and fingers, put his compression socks on himself! This gives him a sense of independence which we all value.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine B.

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, it works perfectly! I have bad back and hip, so it was almost impossible to put on my compression socks in the morning. It would be great if it can be folded down for travel, just a suggestion. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: D. Chen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. I was able to figure out how to use it right away. So easy to get my thigh-high support hose on without help. Sturdy enough to stand up by itself while I was using it.
customer_reviews.author: Kayakgirl7

customer_reviews.title: Great assistance
customer_reviews.text: As described in description. Great for assisting on putting on the stocking
customer_reviews.author: Rita Daigle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome dressing aid for disabled
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Feels like someone else is putting my socks on for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Don't even try not using this!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness, how on earth do you put those crazy stockings on without using something like this??? It was like shoving my foot into a straw! I put the stocking on in 30 seconds flat with this donner. Grrrrr! Darn varicose veins! Lol
customer_reviews.author: SAMANTHA

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well-made item
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, well-made item. However, it didn't work for my husband because he has very little flexibility of his ankles, and one must be able to point his/her feet to use the item effectively.
customer_reviews.author: NK

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Makes putting on compression socks easier. I'm glad I found this product. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie McPhail

customer_reviews.title: Will make your life easier.
customer_reviews.text: This contraption is a life saver. So easy to use and shipping was FAST.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Talley

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help my nana as her stockings must be ever so tight making them difficult to put on. With its simple design and easy to use feature this product is definately worth the price. Quality is good as well for what the product is used for.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin A.

customer_reviews.title: My daughter has dressings on her heel because of a ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has dressings on her heel because of a wound. The compression socks would always roll up the dressing. This has been a time saver and a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help my elderly Mother with her support stockings. It is very easy to use, even she can do it. This will save our thumbs and fingers the wear of putting on support hose.
customer_reviews.author: SusanTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Lousy Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Item was as advertised, but was too small for me. Two attempts to return (up to 48 hours for response) and NO response. I can't use it, they won't take it back... I'd stay away from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Carter

customer_reviews.title: It works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: The only problem is that I wish I had two.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Anyone who wears compression socks or has a loved one who needs to wear them this is the Best product out there to aide putting them on!
customer_reviews.author: gail trykowski

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This Has Helped My Dad Alot He's Has a Hard Time Getting His Compressions On This Has Helped Us Alot Fast Shipping Awesome Great Price
customer_reviews.author: Blake Morrow

customer_reviews.title: I’ll just keep on trying!
customer_reviews.text: I’m having a very hard time getting the hang of this Donner. Guess I’ll just have to keep on trying!
customer_reviews.author: T. Nunnelee

customer_reviews.title: Extremely difficult to put on. I cannot do it ...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely difficult to put on. I cannot do it without help and I would immegin not many women 84 years old can either.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Stahl

customer_reviews.title: medical stocking donner
customer_reviews.text: could not use and it did not tell enough about the product. Had to send it back and pay 11.95 postage for across town 25 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Lynette A. Steward

customer_reviews.title: They should have given leg measurements.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing, doesn't fit large legs. Tried to give it away for free, no takers.
customer_reviews.author: Synet

customer_reviews.title: Handles a little short
customer_reviews.text: Works great except for the handles being a few inches short for people that have back bending problems 18 to 20 inches with maybe a 25 degree outward angle would be preferred for me.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS F. S

customer_reviews.title: Help for a difficult task.
customer_reviews.text: It is not the easiest to use, but anything to make this task easier is a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this product did not work out for my parents but the seller was very accommodating for the return. The stocking donner arrived well packaged and I noted that the frame seemed quite sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Still difficult to get stockings on.
customer_reviews.text: Product assists. But is not a total solution to donning compression stockings. Still a difficult process. Largely due to my obesity and lack of flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: FRED PARKER

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: Impossible for me to use with thigh high support socks. I don't know about knee highs.
customer_reviews.author: Warren J.

customer_reviews.title: It's not the best you can buy
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. Awkward to use and is very hard on the socks
customer_reviews.author: Dave M.

customer_reviews.title: It works great for support hose
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several sock assist since I have had a knee and hip replacement, this is the first one I have got to work with support hose. It took a few tries to learn how to use it but I have it working great now.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product was more than I hoped for. My husband can now put on his compression socks by himself! They went on so easy and uniform. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built. It worked but took a lot of ...
customer_reviews.text: Solidly built. It worked but took a lot of much effort for my wide foot. Wished it did work. I need to find a larger "foot" capable device.
customer_reviews.author: TJB

customer_reviews.title: okay
customer_reviews.text: I struggle pulling the sock over it. I have arthritis in my fingers and thumbs. I found that using rubber gloves helped me more.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny E

customer_reviews.title: Socks conquered!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product and makes putting on socks easy as can be
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Wright

customer_reviews.title: Ease
customer_reviews.text: Great productive. Such a help to get my compression socks on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Insure that heel of sock is all the way to the top of the Donner.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. I bought two to preload socks at night which makes it quicker in the a.m. to put the compression socks on.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Mayhew

customer_reviews.title: Whenever a person retains water in their feet and ankles ...
customer_reviews.text: Whenever a person retains water in their feet and ankles, those parts swell up so I wish it was a little larger in width.
customer_reviews.author: John Simonin

customer_reviews.title: Due to limited flexibility I am unable to place my ...
customer_reviews.text: Due to limited flexibility I am unable to place my foot in the device. I suspect that if was taller I could use it. As is I am unable to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great but very hard to use with high compression stockings
customer_reviews.text: Great but very hard to use with high compression stockings. I can't get mine one the Donner far enough to get my foot in. I hve 40/50 mg compression.
customer_reviews.author: addison ehrlich

customer_reviews.title: Great help with health problem
customer_reviews.text: This item with helping me to get compression stockings on. Works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Lou vieau

customer_reviews.title: great device
customer_reviews.text: this is the only way to put on pressure stockings
customer_reviews.author: Steve Julian

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to use
customer_reviews.text: Impossible to use for a hip replacement patient on their own .
customer_reviews.author: Penny L.

customer_reviews.title: Product was great
customer_reviews.text: My mother needed a stocking donner and this one did the trick. However the box came damaged and it scraped off paint from the donner.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: stocking donner
customer_reviews.text: takes a few trials to train yourself, I ware lrg. knee hi 20-30 mmhg. I found if you put stocking over the donner to almost the toes it works great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Bunce

product_meta.title: Jobst 110913 Stocking Donner 1 Each
product_meta.description: The Jobst Stocking Donner is an exceptionally convenient compression stocking aid designed to help those with limited hand strength and dexterity put on their support wear and compression stockings. The compact size and weight make it ideal for travel and easy to store, while the durable epoxy finish ensures the Jobst Stocking Donner will not snag or put runs in your compression stockings. Protect your hands and your Stockings, How To Use Jobst Stocking Donner: Step 1: Place your compression stocking aid inside the semi-circle frame and pull the top of the stocking down over the semi-circle. The heel of the stocking must face the back of the Jobst Stocking Donner. (Figure 1) Step 2: Continue to slide the stocking down over the semi-circle until the heel is centered and even with the top of the semi-circle. (It may be necessary to pull the heel farther down depending on foot and stocking size.) (Figure 2) Step 3: While sitting, insert your foot into the stocking until your foot is completely on the floor. Helpful tip: Hold the heel pocket against the frame as your slide your toes into the stocking.(Figure 3) Step 4: Grasp the padded handles of the Jobst Stocking Donner and gently pull the donner and stocking up the leg until the stocking is above the calf. Try not to overstretch the stocking (Figure 4) Step 5: Pull the Jobst Stocking Sonner backward and down, free of the stocking. (Figure 5) Step 6: Be sure the heel of the stocking is properly placed on the foot, then adjust the length and smooth out any wrinkles by stroking and smoothing with the palm of your hands Jobst Stocking Donner Returns: Due to the hygiene or rehabilitation nature of this product, it is non-returnable.
feature_bullets: The Jobst® Stocking Donner is an exceptionally convenient compression stocking aid designed to help those with limited hand strength and dexterity put on their support wear and compression stockings.
